title: Chase is suing me
question: chase is suing me for 5,000. is ther any way to settle out of court or do i have to get aa attorney?
answers:
Please take a look at my Legal Guide on just this topic (link below), which has some important do's and don'ts.

If you need legal assistance, I have been representing consumers sued on bad debts since 1997. You may want to contact me through my Avvo profile, which also includes several testimonials from former clients, whom I represented on bad debt cases.

You can always settle a claim. You'll get the best settlement with a lawyer, and often a litigant gets the best settlement by answering the complaint and negotiating from a position of strength. You may even have a good defense to the suit, like an expired statute of limitations, so they'd owe you your legal fees.

But sometimes it doesn't make sense to fight a claim, it makes more sense to threaten to file bankruptcy so the claimant would get nothing.

What makes sense for you depends on your financial situation, the existence of other claims, and the facts of Chase's claims, and only your own lawyer that you disclose everything to can advise you.
